00040 /**
00041  * @file
00042  *
00043  * Interface to the On Chip Logic Analyzer (OCLA) hardware.
00044  *
00045  * The ocla provides capabilities to trace internal transactions for software
00046  * debugging, performance tuning, and hardware diagnostics.
00047  *
00048  * The ocla receives 72 bits of data from coprocessors or capture points via
00049  * debug bus transmitters (DTXs). These 72 bits of data are broken up into two
00050  * halves of 36 bits each.
00051  *
00052  *                          ----------------------------
00053  *                          |                          |
00054  *         data from DTXs   |                          |
00055  *        ----------------->|         ocla             |
00056  *         2 36-bit halves  |                          |
00057  *             (72 bits)    |                          |
00058  *                          ----------------------------
00059  *
00060  * The ocla alignes each bit of data (Aligner).
00061  * The aligner passes the data to the 4 matchers.
00062  * The matchers pass the data to the FSMs.
00063  * The FSMs determine when to capture data. When the FSM requests a capture, the
00064  * data is stored in the data fifo and optionally overflows to ddr/L2 cache.
00065  *
00066  *                  X 1               X 4             X 2              X 1
00067  *              -----------       -----------       -------       -------------
00068  *         DTX  |         |       |         |       |     |       |           |
00069  *        ----->| Aligner |------>| Matcher |------>| FSM |------>| data fifo |
00070  *              |         |   ^   |         |       |     |   |   |           |
00071  *              -----------   |   -----------       -------   |   -------------
00072  *                            |                               |
00073  *                            ---------------------------------
00074  *
00075  * Debug Bus Transmitters (DTX):
00076  *  . The DTXs feed the OCLA.
00077  *  . The DTXs get data from points outside the ocla.
00078  *  . Each dtx can drive one or both 36-bit halves.
00079  *  . Each 36-bit halve can be shared by multiple DTXs, but each DTX must 
00080  *    drive a different set of bits.
00081  *  . Each DTX must be configured to select which data format will be put on
00082  *    the 36-bit halve. The data formats are hardcoded in the hardware.
00083  *    Software simple selects the format to use.
00084  *
00085  * Aligner:
00086  *  . The aligner delays each bit to correct for the variable amount of
00087  *    propagation delay between signals from different blocks.
00088  *
00089  * Matchers:
00090  *      . Each matcher contains a mask and data to compere the aligned data
00091  *    with.
00092  *  . Each matcher also contains a 32-bit counter. This counter can be used
00093  *    to count the number of matches or to collect samples of capture data
00094  *    (sample every Nth match, or match after every Nth cycle).
00095  *
00096  * FSMs:
00097  *  . Each FSM is implemented as a programmable logic array (PLA) style
00098  *    organization, with 15 inputs and 4 outputs.
00099  *
00100  *  . The 15 inputs are:
00101  *      . Matchers output (x4).
00102  *      . Previous state of FSM0 (x4).
00103  *      . Previous state of FSM1 (x4).
00104  *      . Multicore debug wires (x3).
00105  *
00106  *  . The 15 inputs are manipulated and produce the 4 outputs.
00107  *  . The 4 outputs select one of 16 states the fsm can transtion to.
00108  *  . Each of the 16 states can be configured to capture data, generate
00109  *    an interrupt, etc.
00110  *
00111  *  . The FSM implementation is that of an PLA:
00112  *
00113  *                          AND0  AND1        AND15
00114  *                            |    |   .....    |
00115  *            mcd      -------+----+------------+--
00116  *                            |    |            |
00117  *            matchers -------+----+------------+--
00118  *                            |    |            |
00119  *            fsm0     -------+----+------------+--
00120  *                            |    |            |
00121  *            fsm1     -------+----+------------+--
00122  *                            |    |            |
00123  *                            |    |            |
00124  *                          --+----+------------+-------- OR0
00125  *                            |    |            |
00126  *                          --+----+------------+-------- OR1
00127  *                            |    |            |    .
00128  *                            |    |            |    .
00129  *                            |    |            |    .
00130  *                            |    |            |    .
00131  *                          --+----+------------+-------- OR15
00132  *                            |    |            |
00133  *                            |    |            |
00134  *
00135  *  . AND Columns:
00136  *      . Each AND column ANDs all 15 input signals and all 15
00137  *        complemented input signals.
00138  *      . Any signal can be ignored. To ignore a signal, both the
00139  *        signal and it's complement must be set.
00140  *          . An AND column will be true (1) when all it's selected input
00141  *        signals are 1.
00142  *
00143  *     . OR rows:
00144  *          . Each OR row must be configured to select one of the AND
00145  *        columns.
00146  *      . The OR row that is true (it's configured AND column is true)
00147  *        determines the new fsm state. If OR row 4 is true, the fsm
00148  *        transitions to state 4.
00149  *      . The OR rows are prioritized with row 0 having the highest
00150  *        priority and row 15 the lowest. This means if both row 3 and
00151  *        row 4 are true, the fsm will transition to state 3.
00152  *
00153  * Data fifos:
00154  *      . The 72-bits of potential capture data is split into two 36-bit halves.
00155  *  . Capture of each half can be controlled by either a single FSM or by a
00156  *    combination of both FSM outputs.
00157  *  . Captured data is in the form of 38-bit-wide capture entries.
00158  */
00159 
00160

00171 /* These are the ocla hardware revisions and the chips that use them */
00172 #define IS_OCLA_REV1        (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS1_X) ||     \
00173                  OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN76XX) ||         \
00174                  OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN70XX))

00176 #define IS_OCLA_REV2        (OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN78XX_PASS2_X) ||     \
00177                  OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CN73XX) ||         \
00178                  OCTEON_IS_MODEL(OCTEON_CNF75XX))

00183  */

00186     ASE,
00187     BBX1I,
00188     BBX2I,
00189     BBX3I,
00190     BCH,
00191     BGX,
00192     BTS,

00199     FPA,

00201     GSER,
00202     HNA,

00204     ILK,
00205     IOBN,
00206     IOBP,
00207     IOB,
00208     IPD,
00209     KEY,

00241     SATA,

00244     SRIO,
00245     SSO,
00246     TDEC,
00247     TIM,
00248     ULFE,
00249     USBH,
00250     USBDRD,
00251     VDEC,
00252     WPSE,
00253     WRCE,
00254     WRDE,
00255     WRSE,
00256     WTXE,
00257     XCV,
00258     XSX,
00259     ZIP,
00260     INVALID_BLOCK_ID = -1
00261 } cvmx_dtx_id_t;
00262 
00263 /**
00264  *  DTX definition.
00265  *
00266  *  half:   36-bit debug bus half used by this DTX.
00267  *  id:     ID of DTX block to configure.
00268  *  inst:   DTX block instance to configure.
00269  *  sel:    One of the hardware hardcoded values to select which signals
00270  *      will be put on the debug bus.
00271  *  ena:    36-bit mask to enable the bits to drive the debug bus.
00272  */
00273 typedef struct {
00274     uint            half;
00275     cvmx_dtx_id_t       id;
00276     uint            inst;
00277     uint64_t        sel;
00278     uint64_t        ena;
00279 } cvmx_dtx_def_t;
00280 
00281 /**
00282  * Capture request.
00283  *
00284  *  node:           Node to capture data on.
00285  *  ix:             Ocla complex index.
00286  */
00287 struct cap_req {
00288     uint            node;
00289     uint            ix;
00290 };
00291 
00292 /**
00293  * Capture ddr buffer request. The kernel must fulfill the request as a
00294  * physical address is needed by ocla.
00295  *
00296  *  node:           Node to capture data on.
00297  *  ix:             Ocla complex index.
00298  *  size:           Size of ddr buffer.
00299  *  pbuf:           Pointer to physicall address of ddr buffer.
00300  */
00301 struct ddr_buf_req {
00302     uint            node;
00303     uint            ix;
00304     uint            size;
00305     uint64_t        pbuf;
00306 };
00307 
00308 /* Ioctl commands */
00309 #define OCLA_CAP_REQ        _IOW('o', 0x01, struct cap_req)
00310 #define OCLA_DDR_BUF_REQ    _IOWR('o', 0x02, struct ddr_buf_req)
00311 
00312 /**
00313  * Selects what causes data to be captured.
00314  *
00315  *  NO_CAP      No data is captured.
00316  *  FSM0_CAP        Capture when fsm0 requests it.
00317  *  FSM1_CAP        Capture when fsm1 requests it.
00318  *  FSM0_OR_FSM1    Capture when fsm0 or fsm1 request it.
00319  *  FSM0_AND_FSM1   Capture when fsm0 and fsm1 request it.
00320  *  CAP         Always capture.
00321  */
00322 typedef enum {
00323     NO_CAP = 0,
00324     FSM0_CAP = 2,
00325     FSM1_CAP = 4,
00326     FSM0_OR_FSM1_REV1 = 6,
00327     FSM0_AND_FSM1 = 8,
00328     FSM0_OR_FSM1_REV2 = 0xe,
00329     CAP = 0xf
00330 } cvmx_cap_sel_t;
00331 
00332 /**
00333  * Describe a fsm input.
00334  *
00335  *  msk         Bit mask.
00336  *  val         Bit values
00337  */
00338 typedef struct {
00339     uint8_t     msk;
00340     uint8_t     val;
00341 } cvmx_fsm_input_t;
00342 
00343 /**
00344  * Bit mask of actions to take by fsm states.
00345  *
00346  *  NO_ACTION       Do nothing.
00347  *  ACTION_CAP      Capture.
00348  *  ACTION_INT      Generate an interrupt.
00349  */
00350 typedef enum {
00351     NO_ACTION   = 0,
00352     ACTION_CAP  = 1,
00353     ACTION_INT  = 2
00354 } cvmx_fsm_action_t;
00355

00359  * @return Returned value. Zero on success, -1 otherwise.
00360  */
00361 extern int cvmx_dtx_reset(void);

00363 /**
00364  * Setup the Debug Transmitters (DTX) hardware.
00365  *

00368  * 
00369  * @return Returned value. Zero on success, -1 otherwise.

00401 extern int cvmx_ocla_clear_interrupts(int node, int ix);

00413 /**
00414  * Initialize the OCLA hardware.
00415  *
00416  * @param node      Node ocla complex is on.
00417  * @param ix        OCLA complex to initialize.
00418  * @param buf       Pointer to ddr buffer to use as capture buffer.
00419  * @param buf_size  Size of ddr capture buffer.
00420  * @param num_entries   Number of entries to capture. Zero for wrapping mode.
00421  * @param lo_cap    Selects when to capture the lower 36-bit debug bus half.
00422  * @param hi_cap    Selects when to capture the upper 36-bit debug bus half.
00423  * 
00424  * @return Returned value. Zero on success, -1 otherwise.
00425  */
00426 extern int cvmx_ocla_init(int node, int ix, uint64_t buf, uint buf_size,
00427               int num_entries, cvmx_cap_sel_t lo_cap,
00428               cvmx_cap_sel_t hi_cap);
00429 
00430 /**
00431  * Initialize the OCLA matchers hardware.
00432  *
00433  * @param node      Node matcher is on.
00434  * @param ix        OCLA complex to initialize.
00435  * @param mat       Matcher to initialize.
00436  * @param lo_mask   Mask for the lower 36-bit debug bus half.
00437  * @param lo_val    Value to match in the lower 36-bit debug bus half.
00438  * @param hi_mask   Mask for the upper 36-bit debug bus half.
00439  * @param hi_val    Value to match in the upper 36-bit debug bus half.
00440  * 
00441  * @return Returned value. Zero on success, -1 otherwise.
00442  */
00443 extern int cvmx_matcher_init(int node, int ix, int mat, uint64_t lo_mask,
00444                  uint64_t lo_val, uint64_t hi_mask,
00445                  uint64_t hi_val);
00446 
00447 /**
00448  * Initialize the OCLA finite state machine hardware.
00449  *
00450  * @param node      Node fsm is on.
00451  * @param ix        OCLA complex to initialize.
00452  * @param fsm       Fsm to initialize.
00453  * @param mcd       MCD inputs to use.
00454  * @param matcher   Matcher inputs to use.
00455  * @param fsm0_st   Fsm0 state to use as input.
00456  * @param fsm1_st   Fsm1 state to use as input.
00457  * @param new_st    State to transtion to when all inputs are true.
00458  * 
00459  * @return Returned value. Zero on success, -1 otherwise.
00460  */
00461 extern int cvmx_fsm_init(int node, int ix, int fsm, cvmx_fsm_input_t *mcd,
00462              cvmx_fsm_input_t *matcher, cvmx_fsm_input_t *fsm0_st,
00463              cvmx_fsm_input_t *fsm1_st, uint new_st);

00474 extern int cvmx_fsm_enable(int node, int ix, int fsm);

00476 /**
00477  * Set the action to take for a fsm state.
00478  *
00479  * @param node      Node fsm is on.
00480  * @param ix        OCLA complex fsm is on.
00481  * @param fsm       Fsm to initialize.

00483  * @param action    Action for the fsm state.
00484  * 
00485  * @return Returned value. Zero on success, -1 otherwise.
00486  */
00487 extern int cvmx_fsm_state_set(int node, int ix, int fsm, uint state,

00490 /**

00495  * @param data      Updated with packet read.

00497  * @return Returned value. Zero if packet is valid, -1 otherwise.

00499 extern int cvmx_ocla_get_packet(int node, int ix, uint64_t *data);

00505  * @param ix        OCLA complex whose fifo is to be checked.

00507  * @return Returned value. Zero if fifo is not full, 1 if it's full.

00509 extern int cvmx_is_fifo_full(int node, int ix);
